Name: Propaquizafop
Description: Propaquizafop is a quinoxaline derivative used as systemic herbicide for annual and perennial grasses. It has a role as a xenobiotic, an environmental contaminant, an agrochemical and a phenoxy herbicide. It is an aromatic ether, an organochlorine compound, a quinoxaline derivative, a carboxylic ester and an oxime O-ether.

plant_translocations.content: The study investigated the absorption, translocation, metabolism, and effects of propaquizafop on acetyl-CoA carboxylase (ACCase) isoforms in chickpea (Cicer arientinum L.). Maximum foliar absorption of propaquizafop, around 35% of the recovered herbicide, occurred 48 hours after treatment. Approximately 30% of the absorbed propaquizafop was rapidly metabolized to the acid form, followed by a slow conversion to a polar metabolite. About 4% of foliar-applied [14C]propaquizafop was translocated from the treated leaflets within 72 hours after application. Proteins from isolated chloroplast stromal and cytosolic fractions were separated and probed, revealing the presence of a multifunctional ACCase in the cytosolic fraction and a 36-kDa biotinylated subunit of the multi-subunit ACCase in the chloroplast stromal fraction. The study suggests that ACCase activity in both fractions exhibits a high level of tolerance to propaquizafop acid and other graminicides, and total ACCase activity in the chickpea chloroplast stroma fraction appears to be composed of activities contributed by both multisubunit and multifunctional ACCases.
plant_translocations.reference: Giménez-Espinosa, R., Plaisance, K. L., Plank, D. W., Gronwald, J. W., & De Prado, R. (1999). Propaquizafop absorption, translocation, metabolism, and effect on acetyl-CoA carboxylase isoforms in chickpea (Cicer arietinum L.). Pesticide Biochemistry and Physiology, 65(2), 140-150.

method.Apply Location: Foliar application on adaxial surface of leaflets
method.Plant Grown Condition: Plants grown in pots with fertilized peat and sandy loam (1:2) in growth chamber at 25/18°C day/night, 16 h photoperiod, 80% RH. Plants used at 3-4 weeks old, 3-4 leaf stage.
method.Chemical Preparation: [14C]Propaquizafop (specific activity 0.092 mCi/mg) mixed with commercial propaquizafop formulation to 1.89 nCi/ml. Propaquizafop acid generated by base hydrolysis of propaquizafop ester and purified
method.Pesticide Application Details for the Pl: [14C]Propaquizafop formulation (~0.25 cm2) applied as 8 droplets of 0.5 ml each to adaxial surface near midsection of second compound leaf of 3-4 week old plants.
method.Other Information: Plants harvested at 12, 24, 48, 72 h after treatment and sectioned into treated leaf, acropetal/basipetal leaflets, upper/lower stems, roots.
